text: the next question is about nerve
supplements there are some nutritional
supplements that are that advise my
patients to take when they're dealing
with entrapments of the nerves and their
extremities I treat only the upper
extremity but I think that could
probably apply in other parts of the
body what I advise them to take is
magnesium vitamin b-complex so all the B
vitamins not just the b6 to the b12 but
all of them coenzyme q10 alpha lipoic
acid and a settle carnitine so those are
the ones the primary ones I recommend
and I would advise that patients take
those before during and after surgery no
one knows how long and you know I always
make sure that the patients speak to
their pharmacist to make sure there's no
funny business happening with the
medication or any diseases that they may
have there's limited data on the subject
but there's some animal studies showing
benefits with respect to nerve recovery
nerve pain it's been used in patients
with neuropathy including diabetic
neuropathy and it's been quite active
and effective with pain and tingling and
numbness and such things so I think it
just makes sense to support nerve
healing after decompressing the nerve
